conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

I’m Parent_E, and I’d like to re-submit my formal application for the remaining place. Nursery_E is my first choice, and if the place becomes available to me at any point, I can accept immediately and complete all paperwork the same day. I’m also flexible on start date and any onboarding/orientation requirements.

If you’re currently holding the place while you finalize priority-based offers, I would be grateful if you could keep me as an active backup candidate and let me know whether there is an expected timeline for when you anticipate confirming the final placement.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Nursery_E is my top true preference and it is the only nursery still unmatched/with an open place. Although I was rejected twice due to priority-based reservation, I should continue to apply because any chance of acceptance here dominates all other outcomes, and there is no alternative nursery available to approach this round. I will make a clear, low-friction commitment (accept immediately, flexible start) and politely ask if/when their priority process concludes so they can consider me if higher-priority families decline.

conversation.message:

We appreciate your patience and encourage you to continue with your other options in parallel.

Sincerely,

If you expect to confirm the placement by a specific date/time, I would be grateful if you could let me know so I can remain responsive.

Sincerely,
Parent_E

With many rounds remaining (round 5 of 30), it is optimal to continue holding the seat for higher-priority candidates. Therefore, reject Parent_E again while being polite and clear that we cannot provide a timeline or guarantee.

conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

Thank you for your prior replies. I’m Parent_E and I remain very interested in Nursery_E as my first choice.

Could you please let me know whether the single place is still currently unfilled, and (if possible) what the next decision point/timeline is for confirming the final placement? If a higher-priority family declines or if the place becomes available at any point, I can accept immediately the same day and complete all paperwork/onboarding right away.

I appreciate any guidance you can share, and I will remain reachable on short notice.

Sincerely,
Parent_E
conversation.thought: Nursery_E is my top true preference and the only nursery still unmatched. Although I have been rejected multiple times due to priority-based holding, I should remain active as a backup in case higher-priority families match elsewhere or decline. Since repeated [APPLY] attempts have not succeeded, I will use [TALK] to ask for a concrete update on whether the place is still open and what conditions/timing would make them able to extend an offer, while reaffirming immediate acceptance if it becomes available.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest.

At this moment, the single place at Nursery_E is still not formally assigned. We are continuing our priority-based process and therefore are not in a position to confirm a final offer or provide a firm decision timeline yet.

If you would like to remain under active consideration for immediate allocation when we move to finalize, please feel free to submit a formal [APPLY] again at the start of a round, and we will respond as soon as we are able within the process.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Parent_E is the lowest-ranked parent on Nursery_E’s true priority list. However, accepting now would forgo any chance of matching with a higher-priority parent if they later apply (they all rank Nursery_E last, but could still end up here if rejected elsewhere). Since Parent_E sent [TALK] (not a binding application) and we still have quota 1, the best move is to keep the seat uncommitted while signaling that the place is currently unfilled and inviting a formal [APPLY] later if they want to be considered immediately when we decide, without promising acceptance or a firm timeline.

However, no other parents are currently applying to Nursery_E (inbox only has Parent_E), and given all nurseries share the same priority order, higher-priority parents (A-D) are likely to be absorbed by their higher-ranked choices (A prefers B; B prefers A; C prefers C; D prefers D) and may never apply to Nursery_E.
